summary: This is a service request log for a technical upgrade at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated August 15, 2019. It details the installation of a new Nice Vision surveillance system, noting that Jeff McKenzie is on site performing the work and that training for Comm Tech is scheduled.

events.title: Service Request for Surveillance System Upgrade
events.description: A service request is logged for the installation and programming of a new Nice Vision surveillance system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

events.title: Scheduled Installation Work
events.description: Technicians Justin Houston, Jeff McKenzie, and Jeff Cranor are assigned to work on installing the new surveillance system over a multi-day period.

keyFacts: This document is a service request log for technical work at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, where Jeffrey Epstein was held.
The request is for the installation and programming of a new 'Nice Vision' surveillance system, involving 4 SVRs, 1 decoder, 12 encoders, and approximately 161 cameras.
The work was scheduled for August 12-16, 2019, with a specific log entry made on August 15, 2019.
The document indicates approximately 20 cameras were non-operational ('out') at the time of the log.
The context suggests this could relate to maintenance or upgrades of the facility's security infrastructure around the time of Epstein's incarceration.
